titleStmt.title: Robert Sandford et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8709

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To his Excellency Jas F Robertson
Gov of the Commonwealth of Ky

We your undersigned petitioners do humbly pray that the painful situation in which J. W. Greenwell, is placed in Your prison, in the worst Kind of health, laboring as he has for near nine Years, and now of no more use to the prison. We ask for Your consideration and his release,

Monterey 27th Feby 1863
Names
Robert Sandford
Churchill Fitzgerald.
Paul T Howe
A. J. holdon
C. M G Hitese
A F Rogers
B,, F,, Wiley
George Marken
John Care
William Wiebb
James Fitzgerald
John Q Robertson
Joseph Robertson
Wm B McGuire
M. H. Blount
John C Robertson
James H Lewis
Will T Quarley
Pettn for pardon of J. W. Greenwald from Owen County
